page.title: 02A PUPIL'S SUNDAY DINNER.
page.content: REBECCA HOWLEY IS ELEVEN AND GOES TO TRELLECH SCHOOL. SHE LIVES AT TREE TOPS WHICH IS BY THE GOCKETT INN. THIS IS A TYPICAL SUNDAY DINNER FOR BECKY HOWLEY'S FAMILY. BECKY HAS DINNER AT 2 O'CLOCK. HER MOTHER COOKS ON A GAS COOKER AND IN A MICROWAVE. ON THE TABLE IS A CLOTH AND CUTTLERY. SHE EATS HER DINNER IN THE DINING ROOM HER DAD SITS AT THE TOP OF THE TABLE. HER MUM IS QUITE STRICT ON TABLE MANNERS. THE FIRST COURSE IS THE MAIN COURSE THEY HAVE ROAST PORK,CARROTS,PEAS SOMETIMES CABBAGE AND ROAST POTATOES. TO DRINK, BECKY AND HER BROTHER HAVE LEMONADE AND HER PARENTS HAVE WINE. FOR PUDDING SHE HAS RICE PUDDING. AFTERWARDS BECKY AND HER DAD DO THE WASHING UP.
